text: Qualcomm has launched its first Snapdragon Experience Zone in India. The chipmaker partnered with India's leading retail chain Croma to open its Snapdragon Experience Zone in the country. It's located at Croma's store in Juhu, Mumbai, and Qualcomm plans to open more Snapdragon Experience Zones at Croma stores across India. With the Snapdragon Experience Zone, Qualcomm will showcase the devices from its partners powered by the Snapdragon platforms. These include smartphones, PCs, wearables, and hearables. The Snapdragon Experience Zone will also have expert staff trained to help customers get a glimpse of on-device AI and experience how it can transform their on-device experience. Neither Qualcomm nor Croma have revealed where they will open the next Snapdragon Experience Zone, but we know that Qualcomm is hosting an event in New Delhi, India, on February 24 in partnership with Asus to announce new Snapdragon X-powered products in the Asian country. Additionally, India will be one of the first markets to get devices powered by the recently announced Snapdragon 6 Gen 4 SoC.
html:
Qualcomm has launched its first Snapdragon Experience Zone in India. The chipmaker partnered with India's leading retail chain Croma to open its Snapdragon Experience Zone in the country. It's located at Croma's store in Juhu, Mumbai, and Qualcomm plans to open more Snapdragon Experience Zones at Croma stores across India.

With the Snapdragon Experience Zone, Qualcomm will showcase the devices from its partners powered by the Snapdragon platforms. These include smartphones, PCs, wearables, and hearables.

The Snapdragon Experience Zone will also have expert staff trained to help customers get a glimpse of on-device AI and experience how it can transform their on-device experience.

Neither Qualcomm nor Croma have revealed where they will open the next Snapdragon Experience Zone, but we know that Qualcomm is hosting an event in New Delhi, India, on February 24 in partnership with Asus to announce new Snapdragon X-powered products in the Asian country.

Additionally, India will be one of the first markets to get devices powered by the recently announced Snapdragon 6 Gen 4 SoC.
